content:
Do we want to rename "Display settings" in the gear menu to "User interface"? I think structurally, it happens that essentially all of our user interface settings control how something is displayed, but that seems like a more clear label for this. Also, it's the only menu option that has "settings" in it, which feels redundant; they are all settings.

image.png

(Maybe worth a bit of research on what other products call this, in case there's a better phrasing)

We may in the future also split out some things, like "Language and time", to a separate panel, but probably it'd still be net helpful to rename the catch-all to something like "User interface" or "Interface" or something.

(We'd probably change the API as well in follow-up work once we've changed the user-facing labels).
I'm kinda "meh" on this proposal. I don't have good reasons, just giving my vote.
I think that "User Interface" is a broad topic and may refer to a wider concept, maybe display-settings can be renamed to display instead.

Looking at czo, my preference would probably be towards "Interface" (maybe "User Interface", if we're being more general/friendly?) for the category. I think one reason to definitely change in some way is simply that there's a repetition of "display settings" inside "display settings"!
However, all the sections within this category also have "...settings" (language, display, time, emoji), which seems superfluous too. Display is very general in terms of the component settings so could be more tricky, but can we just strip off the "settings" at the end of them?

Then we'd have:
SETTINGS/INTERFACE:

  • Language
  • Display
  • Time
  • Emoji
I'm not as familiar with other products as others though, just my personal take.
“User interface” is developer-speak; I don’t think I ever see that in a user-facing string.
The reason I am meh on changing this is that I haven’t heard many complaints about the current name.

Anders Kaseorg said:

“User interface” is developer-speak; I don’t think I ever see that in a user-facing string.

I feel like I've seen something like "Interface" as a label for configuration areas within games?
I think "Display settings" is already not descriptive of some of the settings we have in that bundle.

If it is within games, that's an area that is often comfortable exposing users to developer-speak in a way that isn't normal in other kinds of software (well, except software for developers), so that fits.
“Interface” is better than “user interface”, and IMO goes back to the level of Steve’s “meh”.
I guess “convert emoticons before sending” is the setting that’s least clearly display-related.
"Default view" is kinda tenuous as well.
